segments.en: Hello, English learners.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者。

segments.en: Welcome back to another podcast here with us at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到我们的英语播客。

segments.en: My name is Marko.
segments.cn: 我叫马尔科。

segments.en: And I'm Erika.
segments.cn: 我是艾瑞卡。

segments.en: And today we are going to be looking at a very useful lesson because, well, sometimes you need to call a plumber.
segments.cn: 今天我们将学习一个非常实用的课程，因为，有时你需要叫水管工。

segments.en: Okay, so first of all, why don't we start with vocabulary preview because I think we need to know this word plumber.
segments.cn: 好的，首先，我们先来预览一下词汇，因为我认为我们需要知道这个词水管工。

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 词汇预览。

segments.en: Alright, so on vocabulary preview today we're going to look at two words and the first one is the one that we mentioned, plumber.
segments.cn: 好的，今天的词汇预览我们将看两个词，第一个是我们提到的水管工。

segments.en: A plumber.
segments.cn: 水管工。

segments.en: So it's a person, a plumber.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个人，水管工。

segments.en: Yep, and a plumber is the person who fixes everything in your house that is related to water.
segments.cn: 是的，水管工是修理你家与水相关的一切的人。

segments.en: Okay, so he fixes the toilet, the sink, the shower.
segments.cn: 好的，他修理马桶、水槽、淋浴。

segments.en: Yep, that's the plumber.
segments.cn: 是的，这就是水管工。

segments.en: And now the second word is obviously related to plumber and it's water pipes.
segments.cn: 现在第二个词显然与水管工有关，那就是水管。

segments.en: Water pipes as well.
segments.cn: 水管也是。

segments.en: Yep, and those are a tube that carries water in and out of your house.
segments.cn: 是的，那是输送水进出你家的一根管子。

segments.en: Okay, so water pipes.
segments.cn: 好的，所以水管。

segments.en: You also have different types of pipes like gas pipes.
segments.cn: 你还有不同类型的管子，比如燃气管。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Okay, so what are we learning in this lesson?
segments.cn: 那么我们在这节课中学习什么呢？

segments.en: So in this lesson we're going to be learning how to describe when you have problems with plumbing.
segments.cn: 在这节课中，我们将学习如何描述你在水管方面遇到的问题。

segments.en: When you have problems in your sink or in your toilet and how you can describe it.
segments.cn: 当你在水槽或马桶中遇到问题时，你可以如何描述它。

segments.en: And so I think we should take a look at our dialogue for the first time and see what types of problems this woman is having with her plumbing.
segments.cn: 我认为我们应该第一次看看我们的对话，看看这个女人在水管方面遇到了什么问题。

segments.en: Good afternoon, did you call for a plumber?
segments.cn: 下午好，你叫水管工吗？

segments.en: Yes, yes I did.
segments.cn: 是的，我叫了。

segments.en: Please come in.
segments.cn: 请进。

segments.en: I'm so glad you came.
segments.cn: 我很高兴你来了。

segments.en: This old house is falling apart.
segments.cn: 这座老房子快要倒了。

segments.en: Come into the bathroom.
segments.cn: 进浴室看看。

segments.en: See, here, there's water leaking everywhere.
segments.cn: 你看，这里到处都是水在漏。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: Let me have a look.
segments.cn: 让我看看。

segments.en: It seems that your toilet is clogged and that's why it won't flush.
segments.cn: 似乎你的马桶堵了，这就是它无法冲水的原因。

segments.en: Let me just get my plunger.
segments.cn: 让我拿我的抽水器。

segments.en: No, that's not working either.
segments.cn: 不，这也不管用。

segments.en: I suspect that there's some sort of foreign object in the pipe that's causing a blockage.
segments.cn: 我怀疑管道里有某种异物导致堵塞。

segments.en: That's what's making your toilet overflow.
segments.cn: 这就是导致你的马桶溢出的原因。

segments.en: Oh, that must be because of my four-year-old daughter.
segments.cn: 哦，那一定是因为我四岁的女儿。

segments.en: She is always flushing things down in the toilet.
segments.cn: 她总是把东西冲进马桶。

segments.en: You know how kids are.
segments.cn: 你知道孩子们是怎样的。

segments.en: Yeah, I have a little one myself.
segments.cn: 是的，我自己也有一个小孩。

segments.en: Anyway, these water pipes are really rusty, so they also should be changed.
segments.cn: 不管怎样，这些水管真的很生锈，所以也应该更换。

segments.en: That could be causing water to not drain completely.
segments.cn: 这可能导致水无法完全排出。

segments.en: That might lead to more problems in the future.
segments.cn: 这可能会导致将来的更多问题。

segments.en: I would suggest fixing this faucet that isn't shutting off properly.
segments.cn: 我建议修理这个无法正常关闭的水龙头。

segments.en: I could have it all finished by today if it's urgent.
segments.cn: 如果紧急的话，我今天可以全部完成。

segments.en: That would be great.
segments.cn: 那太好了。

segments.en: Is it expensive?
segments.cn: 这贵吗？

segments.en: Let's see, I would say about $800.
segments.cn: 让我们看看，我会说大约800美元。

segments.en: What?
segments.cn: 什么？

segments.en: That's more than I'm making a... Alright, well it sounds like she's having some big problems with her plumbing, but actually I'm really interested that the plumber makes so much money.
segments.cn: 这比我赚的还多……好吧，听起来她在水管方面遇到了一些大问题，但实际上我真的很感兴趣水管工赚这么多钱。

segments.en: That is a very interesting thing, and we're going to talk a little bit about that later on, but I think we should look at those kind of difficult words that we found in the dialogue now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 这真是个有趣的事情，我们稍后会谈论一下，但我认为我们现在应该看看对话中发现的那些困难单词，在语言收获中。

segments.en: So we have five words here, all to do with a plumber and water pipes.
segments.cn: 所以我们这里有五个与水管工和水管有关的词。

segments.en: Now the first word, they talked about that there was water leaking everywhere.
segments.cn: 第一个词，他们提到到处都有水在漏。

segments.en: So you have water leaking.
segments.cn: 所以你有水在漏。

segments.en: Water leaking.
segments.cn: 水在漏。

segments.en: So to leak.
segments.cn: 漏。

segments.en: When something leaks, it lets liquid come out when it shouldn't.
segments.cn: 当某物漏时，它让液体在不应该出来的时候流出。

segments.en: Okay, when it shouldn't.
segments.cn: 好的，在不应该的时候。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So maybe you have a bottle of water and it's closed, but maybe there's a hole in the bottle.
segments.cn: 所以也许你有一瓶水，它是封闭的，但瓶子里可能有一个洞。

segments.en: So it leaks.
segments.cn: 所以它漏了。

segments.en: So it leaks.
segments.cn: 所以它漏了。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Alright, so there was water everywhere, it was leaking, and maybe the reason was because the toilet is clogged.
segments.cn: 好的，所以到处都是水，它在漏，也许原因是马桶堵了。

segments.en: Okay, clogged.
segments.cn: 好的，堵。

segments.en: The toilet's clogged.
segments.cn: 马桶堵了。

segments.en: Clogged.
segments.cn: 堵。

segments.en: Now what does it mean if the toilet is clogged?
segments.cn: 如果马桶堵了，那是什么意思？

segments.en: If the toilet is clogged, there is something that stops the water from going down.
segments.cn: 如果马桶堵了，有东西阻止水流下去。

segments.en: Okay, so there's something blocking it.
segments.cn: 好的，所以有东西在阻挡它。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Okay, a clogged toilet.
segments.cn: 好的，堵塞的马桶。

segments.en: Now the plumber said that it might be clogged and he tried to fix it with a plunger.
segments.cn: 水管工说它可能堵了，他试图用抽水器修理它。

segments.en: A plunger.
segments.cn: 抽水器。

segments.en: A plunger.
segments.cn: 抽水器。

segments.en: A plunger.
segments.cn: 抽水器。

segments.en: Okay, so it's kind of hard to describe what a plunger is, so why don't we listen to the sound a plunger makes in a toilet.
segments.cn: 好的，所以很难描述抽水器是什么，所以我们来听一下抽水器在马桶里发出的声音。

segments.en: Alright, so the plunger is the tool that you use to use a plunger.
segments.cn: 好的，抽水器是你用来使用抽水器的工具。

segments.en: So the plunger didn't work and he wasn't able to fix the toilet and he said there's something in the pipes causing a blockage.
segments.cn: 所以抽水器没有用，他无法修理马桶，他说管道里有东西导致堵塞。

segments.en: Alright, so our next word, a blockage.
segments.cn: 好的，我们下一个词，堵塞。

segments.en: Blockage.
segments.cn: 堵塞。

segments.en: Well, a blockage is something that stops water from flowing.
segments.cn: 好吧，堵塞是阻止水流动的东西。

segments.en: Okay, so something is blocking it.
segments.cn: 好的，所以有东西在阻挡它。

segments.en: So you have blockage.
segments.cn: 所以你有堵塞。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: And we have one more word on language takeaway and that word is faucet.
segments.cn: 我们在语言收获中还有一个词，那就是水龙头。

segments.en: A faucet.
segments.cn: 水龙头。

segments.en: A faucet.
segments.cn: 水龙头。

segments.en: Alright, so the faucet is the part of the sink that lets water come out.
segments.cn: 好的，所以水龙头是水槽中让水流出的部分。

segments.en: Okay, so you have a faucet in your sink.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你在水槽里有一个水龙头。

segments.en: Yeah, so you put your hands under the faucet so you can wash them.
segments.cn: 是的，所以你把手放在水龙头下以便洗手。

segments.en: Okay, that's the faucet.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是水龙头。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So now that we've learned about these different tools and these different ways of describing problems with your plumbing, let's listen to this dialogue another time a little bit slower now and then we'll come back and take a look at some great phrases.
segments.cn: 现在我们已经了解了这些不同的工具和描述水管问题的不同方式，让我们再听一次这个对话，稍微慢一点，然后我们再回来看看一些很好的短语。

segments.en: Good afternoon.
segments.cn: 下午好。

segments.en: Did you call for a plumber?
segments.cn: 你叫水管工吗？

segments.en: Yes, yes I did.
segments.cn: 是的，我叫了。

segments.en: Please come in.
segments.cn: 请进。

segments.en: I'm so glad you came.
segments.cn: 我很高兴你来了。

segments.en: This old house is falling apart.
segments.cn: 这座老房子快要倒了。

segments.en: Come on into the bathroom.
segments.cn: 进浴室吧。

segments.en: See, here there's water leaking everywhere.
segments.cn: 你看，这里到处都是水在漏。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: Let me have a look.
segments.cn: 让我看看。

segments.en: It seems that your toilet is clogged and that's why it won't flush.
segments.cn: 你的马桶似乎堵了，这就是为什么它不能冲水。

segments.en: Let me just get my plunger.
segments.cn: 让我拿我的抽水器。

segments.en: No, that's not working either.
segments.cn: 不，这也不管用。

segments.en: I suspect that there's some sort of foreign object in the pipes that's causing a blockage.
segments.cn: 我怀疑管道里有某种异物导致堵塞。

segments.en: That's what's making your toilet overflow.
segments.cn: 这就是导致你的马桶溢出的原因。

segments.en: Oh, that must be because of my four-year-old daughter.
segments.cn: 哦，那一定是因为我四岁的女儿。

segments.en: She is always flushing things down the toilet.
segments.cn: 她总是把东西冲进马桶。

segments.en: You know how kids are.
segments.cn: 你知道孩子们是怎样的。

segments.en: Yeah, I have a little one myself.
segments.cn: 是的，我自己也有一个小的。

segments.en: Anyway, these water pipes are really rusty so they should also be changed.
segments.cn: 不管怎样，这些水管真的很生锈，所以也应该更换。

segments.en: That could be causing water to not drain completely.
segments.cn: 这可能导致水无法完全排出。

segments.en: That might lead to more problems in the future.
segments.cn: 这可能会在未来导致更多问题。

segments.en: I would also suggest fixing this faucet that isn't shutting off properly.
segments.cn: 我还建议修理这个无法正常关闭的水龙头。

segments.en: I could have it all finished by today if it's urgent.
segments.cn: 如果紧急的话，我今天就可以全部完成。

segments.en: That would be great.
segments.cn: 那太好了。

segments.en: Is it expensive?
segments.cn: 这贵吗？

segments.en: Let's see.
segments.cn: 让我们看看。

segments.en: I would say about eight hundred dollars.
segments.cn: 我想大约八百美元。

segments.en: What?
segments.cn: 什么？

segments.en: That's more than I make in a day and I'm a heart surgeon.
segments.cn: 这比我一天的收入还多，而我是一名心脏外科医生。

segments.en: Well, we've got three phrases that you can use when you need to describe something not working with the pipes.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有三个短语可以用来描述管道出现问题的情况。

segments.en: So let's look at them now in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们在流利度构建器中看看它们。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利度构建器。

segments.en: So the lady called the plumber and he arrived and she described her house as old and that it's falling apart.
segments.cn: 所以这位女士叫了水管工，他来了，她形容她的房子很旧，快要倒了。

segments.en: It's falling apart.
segments.cn: 它快要倒了。

segments.en: This old house is falling apart.
segments.cn: 这座老房子快要倒了。

segments.en: So when something is falling apart, it's old and it's breaking slowly.
segments.cn: 所以当某样东西快要倒了，它是旧的，并且正在慢慢坏掉。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So we can say the house is falling apart or maybe this old car is falling apart.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以说这座房子快要倒了，或者也许这辆旧车快要倒了。

segments.en: You can also use it for people.
segments.cn: 你也可以用它来形容人。

segments.en: Oh, I'm getting so old.
segments.cn: 哦，我变得太老了。

segments.en: I'm falling apart.
segments.cn: 我快要倒了。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So you're getting sick.
segments.cn: 所以你生病了。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: Now for our second word.
segments.cn: 现在是我们的第二个词。

segments.en: Well, the woman said that maybe her daughter was flushing things down the toilet.
segments.cn: 好吧，女人说她的女儿可能在把东西冲进马桶。

segments.en: OK, so to flush something down the toilet.
segments.cn: 好的，所以把东西冲进马桶。

segments.en: To flush something down the toilet.
segments.cn: 把东西冲进马桶。

segments.en: So before we explain this, let's listen to a toilet being flushed.
segments.cn: 在我们解释之前，让我们听一下冲水的声音。

segments.en: OK, so that's the sound of flushing.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是冲水的声音。

segments.en: And when you flush something down the toilet, what happens?
segments.cn: 当你把东西冲进马桶时，会发生什么？

segments.en: So basically you throw something into the toilet and then you flush it.
segments.cn: 基本上你把东西扔进马桶，然后冲水。

segments.en: So it goes away.
segments.cn: 所以它就消失了。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: So flushing something down the toilet.
segments.cn: 所以把东西冲进马桶。

segments.en: Well, she also talked about the faucet and it wasn't shutting off properly.
segments.cn: 好吧，她还谈到了水龙头，它没有正常关闭。

segments.en: Shutting off.
segments.cn: 关闭。

segments.en: To shut off.
segments.cn: 关闭。

segments.en: OK, shut off.
segments.cn: 好的，关闭。

segments.en: When you shut something off, you turn it off.
segments.cn: 当你关闭某样东西时，你把它关掉。

segments.en: OK, so we can say to shut something off or to shut off something.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们可以说关闭某样东西或者把某样东西关掉。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So, hey Marco, can you shut off the computer?
segments.cn: 所以，嘿马尔科，你能把电脑关掉吗？

segments.en: OK, or I can say, can you shut the faucet off?
segments.cn: 好的，或者我可以说，你能把水龙头关掉吗？

segments.en: Great.
segments.cn: 很好。

segments.en: So we took a look at these three phrases that will help you describe, again, these situations or problems that may happen in your bathroom or with liquids.
segments.cn: 所以我们看了这三个短语，它们将帮助你描述这些情况或可能发生在你浴室或液体方面的问题。

segments.en: And well, let's listen to the dialogue for the last time and we'll come back and talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们最后再听一次对话，然后我们再回来聊聊。

segments.en: Good afternoon.
segments.cn: 下午好。

segments.en: Did you call for a plumber?
segments.cn: 你叫水管工吗？

segments.en: Yes, yes, I did.
segments.cn: 是的，我叫了。

segments.en: Please come in.
segments.cn: 请进。

segments.en: I'm so glad you came.
segments.cn: 我很高兴你来了。

segments.en: This old house is falling apart.
segments.cn: 这座老房子快要倒了。

segments.en: Come into the bathroom.
segments.cn: 进浴室吧。

segments.en: See, here, there's water leaking everywhere.
segments.cn: 你看，这里到处都是水在漏。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: Let me have a look.
segments.cn: 让我看看。

segments.en: It seems that your toilet is clogged and that's why it won't flush.
segments.cn: 你的马桶似乎堵了，这就是为什么它不能冲水。

segments.en: Let me just get my plunger.
segments.cn: 让我拿我的抽水器。

segments.en: No, that's not working either.
segments.cn: 不，这也不管用。

segments.en: I suspect that there's some sort of foreign object in the pipe that's causing a blockage.
segments.cn: 我怀疑管道里有某种异物导致堵塞。

segments.en: That's what's making your toilet overflow.
segments.cn: 这就是导致你的马桶溢出的原因。

segments.en: Oh, that must be because of my four year old daughter.
segments.cn: 哦，那一定是因为我四岁的女儿。

segments.en: She is always flushing things down the toilet.
segments.cn: 她总是把东西冲进马桶。

segments.en: You know how kids are.
segments.cn: 你知道孩子们是怎样的。

segments.en: Yeah, I have a little one myself.
segments.cn: 是的，我自己也有一个小的。

segments.en: Anyway, these water pipes are really rusty, so they also should be changed.
segments.cn: 不管怎样，这些水管真的很生锈，所以也应该更换。

segments.en: That could be causing water to not drain completely.
segments.cn: 这可能导致水无法完全排出。

segments.en: That might lead to more problems in the future.
segments.cn: 这可能会在未来导致更多问题。

segments.en: I would suggest fixing this faucet that isn't shutting off properly.
segments.cn: 我建议修理这个无法正常关闭的水龙头。

segments.en: I could have it all finished by today if it's urgent.
segments.cn: 如果紧急的话，我今天就可以全部完成。

segments.en: That would be great.
segments.cn: 那太好了。

segments.en: Is it expensive?
segments.cn: 这贵吗？

segments.en: Let's see.
segments.cn: 让我们看看。

segments.en: I would say about $800.
segments.cn: 我想大约是800美元。

segments.en: What?
segments.cn: 什么？

segments.en: That's more than I'm making a day and I'm...
segments.cn: 这比我一天的收入还多，我...

segments.en: Well, we heard in this dialogue that this plumber is making about $800.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们在这个对话中听说这个水管工的收入大约是800美元。

segments.en: That's a lot of money.
segments.cn: 这很多钱。

segments.en: That's a lot of money.
segments.cn: 这很多钱。

segments.en: And actually, this in many countries is not far from the truth.
segments.cn: 实际上，在许多国家这并不算离谱。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Like, for example, in Canada, there is a shortage.
segments.cn: 比如在加拿大，缺乏这种工人。

segments.en: There's not enough of these people, like plumbers, who can do this type of work, so they can charge a lot of money.
segments.cn: 这些能做这种工作的水管工不够，所以他们可以收取很多钱。

segments.en: So this type of work is called a... he's not really a professional, right?
segments.cn: 所以这种工作被称为... 他其实不是专业人士，对吧？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: But he is a trades person because he works in a trade.
segments.cn: 但他是个技工，因为他从事的是一门手艺。

segments.en: Okay, so like a plumber, an electrician, a person that paints your house.
segments.cn: 好的，比如水管工、电工、给你房子刷漆的人。

segments.en: Those are all trades.
segments.cn: 这些都是技工。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Well, it is true because now many people don't want to learn or do these types of trade because, well, it's not considered to be such a great job, right?
segments.cn: 嗯，这是真的，因为现在很多人不想学习或从事这些手艺，因为这并不被认为是个好工作，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, but the funny thing is now if you're a plumber and you get your first job as a young person, you can make so much more money than a person with a history degree, for example.
segments.cn: 是的，但有趣的是，现在如果你是水管工，作为年轻人获得第一份工作，你能赚比历史学位的人多得多的钱。

segments.en: Exactly, because there is a shortage of these types of... well, you can call them professionals.
segments.cn: 确实如此，因为这类... 嗯，你可以称他们为专业人士的工人短缺。

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Right, so what about in your countries?
segments.cn: 对，那你们国家的情况怎么样？

segments.en: Let us know how these types of trades work.
segments.cn: 让我们知道这些手艺是如何运作的。

segments.en: Are there many of them?
segments.cn: 他们多吗？

segments.en: Are there not many of them?
segments.cn: 他们不多吗？

segments.en: Because, well, of course, in different countries it's a little bit different, right?
segments.cn: 因为，当然，在不同国家情况有点不同，对吧？

segments.en: In some countries there are too many tradesmen.
segments.cn: 在一些国家，技工太多了。

segments.en: So visit us on our website, EnglishPod.com, and tell us all about that.
segments.cn: 所以请访问我们的网站，EnglishPod.com，告诉我们所有这些。

segments.en: And remember, if you have any questions about the lesson, you can ask them there as well.
segments.cn: 记住，如果你对课程有任何问题，也可以在那里问。

segments.en: All right, so we'll see you guys there, and until next time.
segments.cn: 好的，我们在那里见，直到下次。

segments.en: Thanks for downloading and goodbye.
segments.cn: 感谢下载，再见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
